column4: Hello all ! I recently install 10.04 like most of you and ihave been having a problem with my graphics card. Any thoughs?
details pls when asking
well my videos are very choppy and the audio and visual tracks do not match up
and and the visual reactions are not fluid. if that makes sense
what hardware, using compiz, did it work before your upgrade, etc.
i know its from intel on a dell mini 12 and yes it did. my buddy thinks its the driver...
i ran the lspci in terminal and it didnt give me anyything i understood
probably, try in a terminal: lspci | grep VGA
what do you get?
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation System Controller Hub (SCH Poulsbo) Graphics Controller (rev 06)
i checked the intel website and they do not have linux drivers
that's ok. Look in System>Admin...>Harware Drivers - see what's there
just wireless driver
hmm What Dell do you have?
inspiron 1210
oh, laptop!
lol
i have no clue what to do anymore
you said that videos flicker, right?
yes  have you ever seen a computer on television and it flickers...thats what the video on my computer looks liek
what about everything else? Okay, or not - if yes what videos, youtube?
oh, your entire screen is doing this?
no
what about everything else? Okay, or not - if yes what videos, youtube?
ah, did you install ubuntu-restricted-extras ?
how would one do that
I'm not saying it will fix your issue, but sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras
it said that it couldnt find the package
should be: sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras - that should have worked
no it did i tried three times.
this http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/428094/
looks like you need this one: deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ lucid main universe restricted multiverse
i did it second time and its working should i still do what you just sent
no
did you buy your pc from dell?
yes i did
maybe you can contact them regarding your video issue as well. I think Dell sells PCs with ubuntu installed - I could be wrong.
yes they sold this to me with ubuntu 8.04 on it....
the restricted extras might help right
Dells page doesn't mention Linux/Ubuntu anywhere?
ubuntu.dell.com
they sold it to me like this and i think they are kicking themselves for it
heh :)
and dell dose not have any support with ubuntu you have to to call cononical
fair enough
i dont know
once this is done the extras is there anything i need to do
the restricted extras will provide the codecs and what not that ubuntu can't legally package into their OS - some legal thing, go figure. I think I read somewhere that Mint includes them though.
mint
no you shouldn't have to restart. Mint / ubuntu derivitive(?)
I don't mint...
i have no clue what is it
I have heard about issues with flash a lot here lately, that's why I asked what videos you were having issues with.
all of them
so i may never have good vid again
not true, you just need to keep at it. There are several layers that have to work together for your video to be solid. You may have to addess each of them - don't know.
thats the think i have no clue what the layers are lol
np problem, you should do this... Boot into your BIOS, see if it tells you *exactly* what video adapter is installed. Write that down, it will go a long way for getting it set up right.
is there a command or something i have to run
for what?
to find out what vga componant is installed
well you ran lspci, you could try this: sudo lshw, but I don't think it's going to give you anything more.
i meant in bios is there anything i need to do
no, when you power on it should be F2 as it comes up to get into the BIOS
power up hit F2 once a sec or so as it powers up.
f2 is the options isnt it
do this, open up a new terminal, then run: dmesg > dmesg.txt - and paste the entire thing.
to pastbin, that is...It'll tell what driver is being loaded.
there will be a file called dmesg.txt in you home directory...
can you send that to me again pls
do this, open up a new terminal, then run: dmesg > dmesg.txt - and paste the entire thing.
there will be a file called dmesg.txt in you home directory...
here you go http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/428114/
looking, brb
i will be right back...
there?
im back
how old is your laptop?
18 mos
yeah, wierd would you paste the output of: lspci | grep VGA - here please
should only be one line
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation System Controller Hub (SCH Poulsbo) Graphics Controller (rev 06)
great 00:02.0, that's what I needed, ty
what does that mean
is there anything i can do to help
no, I'm a bit dissappointed, that's all. There are a number of things that can probably be done, but I have to get some sleep now. I am sorry, but maybe someone else here can help. Again, sorry man.
thats cool
i feel the same what
i am still trying to understand linux

good luck, but it's not anyones fault, Your harware is "difficult", and not a lot in the way of help on Google. You have to promise to post the fix - should you get it - to the forums so others can benefit, ok.
yeah thanks will do...i have been blowing google up the past days
no doubt, g'night.
